intro: Bonatea pratensis, commonly known as the meadow bonatea, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, and it has distinctive, ribbed stems. Bonatea pratensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
